001.name: Assembly-Line Forebot
001.effect: 1, T: Sacrifice an Artifact then Create a 1/1 Robot artifact creature token with “Start the production line!”

002.name: Assembly-Line Overseer
002.effect:
Vigilance,
While the Assembly-line Overseer is on the battlefield your production level can’t decrease.
002.flavor: “with this no more errors on the production line should occur.” — β-013, Factory Overseer

003.name: Automated Wall Builder
003.effect: T: Put a Degradation Status Aura attached to a land you control. Create a 0/6 colorless Wall artifact creature token with defender. Then target opponent creates a Pollution token.
003.flavor:
“These pests never stop coming. I’m done wasting resources on walls.”
— β-013, Factory Overseer

004.name: Bitters Containment Strike
004.effect:
choose one -
 • destroy all Insects
 • destroy all Wurm
 • destroy all Nests
each opponent creates a Pollution token.
004.flavor: “Erase the infestation. The factory will handle the fallout.” — β-013, Factory Overseer

005.name: Central Command Protocol
005.effect:
At the beginning of your upkeep, if an opponent controls a Pollution token, create a 1/1 colorless Robot artifact creature token with “start the production line.”
Each Optimization permanent you control counts as two for Production level calculations.
005.flavor: “From here, I can optimize everything that matters. The factory will prosper.” — β-013, Factory Overseer

006.name: Centralized Logistics Directive
006.effect:
Optimize 1 (whenever an opponent create a pollution token you may pay 1, if you do draw one card.)
Optimization permanents you control have “T: Add C.”

007.name: Chassi Recovery Unity
007.effect: WW, T: Return to your hand an optimization permanent.

008.name: Combat Wurm
008.effect: Whenever Combat Wurm becomes blocked by one or more Optimization permanents, destroy those permanents. If a permanent is destroyed this way, you may sacrifice a Pollution token.

009.name: Containment Zone Edict
009.effect:
Optimize 1
Whenever one or more creatures attack you, for each of those creatures that’s an Insect Mutant, Wurm, or Horror, that creature’s controller may pay 1. For each that they don’t pay for this way, remove that creature from combat.
009.flavor: “If they insist on coming, the factory will simply reuse them.” — β-013, Factory Overseer

010.name: Coordinated Defensive Grid
010.effect:
Creatures you control get +0/+1.
Whenever a creature attacks you or a planeswalker you control, you may tap an untapped creature you control. If you do, that attacking creature gets -1/-0 until end of turn.

011.name: Crash-Landing Protocol
011.effect:
Create two 0/3 colorless Wall artifact creature tokens with defender.
If you control an Engineer, those tokens gain vigilance until end of turn.

013.name: Emergency Command Relay
013.effect:
Untap up to two target creatures you control.
Creatures you control get +0/+2 until end of turn.

014.name: Emergency Deployment
014.effect: Create two 1/1 white Soldier creature tokens.
014.flavor: “These clones are good for one thing: dying on the front line so the factory can keep growing.” — β-013, Factory Overseer

015.name: Emergency Resource Rationing
015.effect:
Choose one —
• Prevent all damage that would be dealt to you and permanents you control this turn.
• Until end of turn, if a source would deal damage to you, you gain that much life instead.

016.name: Emergency Systems Reboot
016.effect:
Tap all creatures.
Until your next turn, whenever a creature would untap, its controller may have you gain 2 life. If they don’t, that creature doesn’t untap during its controller’s next untap step.
016.flavor: “Full halt. No motion, no noise. I’ll bring systems back online on my terms.” — β-013, Factory Overseer

017.name: Factory Defense Swarm
017.effect:
Flying, vigilance
Whenever your Production level increases, you may pay W. If you do, create a token that’s a copy of Factory Defense Swarm.
At the beginning of your end step, if you created one or more tokens that are copies of Factory Defense Swarm this turn, target opponent creates a Pollution token.
017.flavor: “That should be enough to keep the schedule intact.”  — β-013, Factory Overseer

018.name: Factory Evacuation Protocol
018.effect: Until your next turn, your life total can’t change and you gain protection from everything. All permanents you control phase out. (While they’re phased out, they’re treated as though they don’t exist. they phase in before you untap during your untap step.)

019.name: Factory Shift Rotation
019.effect:
Untap up to two target creatures you control. They gain vigilance until end of turn.
If your Production level is 2 or higher, draw a card.

020.name: Gatehouse Guardian Node
020.flavor:
“If they reach the gate, then the gate was poorly designed.”
— β-013, Factory Overseer

021a.name: Heavy Artillery Blueprint
021a.effect:
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a resource counter on Heavy Artillery Blueprint for each Optimization permanent you control.
T, Remove 50 resource counter from Heavy Artillery Blueprint: Transform it.
021a.flavor: “When in doubt, build a bigger cannon.”       — β-013, Factory Overseer

022.name: Logistic Drone ALFA
022.effect: Optimize 1 (whenever an opponent create a pollution token you may pay 1, if you do draw one card.)

023.name: Logistic Engineer Drone
023.effect:
Optimize 7  (whenever an opponent create a pollution token you may pay 7, if you do draw seven cards.)
You have no maximum hand size.
You may tap optimization permanents to pay for optimize cost.
023.flavor:
“If I can’t solve it with more data, I clearly don’t have enough data yet.” 
— β-013, Factory Overseer

024.name: Logistic Priority Status
024.effect: Whenever you would put another Logistic Priority Status on a permanent that’s already enchanted by one, instead upgrade that Status.

025.name: Logistic Route Optimization
025.effect:
Chose one —
 • Target player’s Production level increases by 1 , then decreases by 1. (Production level can’t go above 3 or below −3 this way.)
 • Target player can’t increase his production level this turn.
 • Target player can’t decrease his production level this turn.
025.flavor: “The shortest path is the one that keeps the factory on schedule.” — β-013, Factory Overseer

026.name: Maintenance Swarm
026.effect:
When Maintenance Swarm enters the battlefield, you may tap up to two target creatures.
Whenever an artifact you control becomes tapped, you may gain 1 life.
026.flavor:
“They don’t complain, don’t rest, don’t fail. Perfect workers.”
— β-013, Factory Overseer

027.name: Ore Convoy Guardian
027.flavor:
“Protect the haulers. Resources without delivery are just rocks.”
— β-013, Factory Overseer

028a.name: Overclocked Defense Status
028a.effect:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+2 and has vigilance.
W: Enchanted Creature gets +0/+1 until end of turn.
028a.flavor: “If the line breaks, the schedule breaks. Unacceptable.” — β-013, Factory Overseer

029.name: Perimeter Defense Turret
029.effect:
Defender
When this creature enters, draw a card.
029.flavor: “This should be enough for now.” — β-013, Factory Overseer

030.name: Perimeter Forcefields
030.effect: Creatures can’t attack you unless their controller pays 2 or Sacrifice a a pollution token for each creature they control that’s attacking you.

031.name: Perimeter Shield Array
031.effect: When you block with zero creatures, you may tap Perimeter Shield Array if it is untapped. If you do, for each attacking creature, create a 0/3 colorless Wall artifact creature token with defender blocking those creatures. Sacrifice them at end of combat.
031.flavor:
“I designed it for ‘overwhelming odds.’ Unfortunately, that seems to be the default setting on this planet.”
— β-013, Factory Overseer

032.name: Planetary Quarantine Order
032.effect:
Choose one —
• Exile target creature with power 4 or greater until Planetary Quarantine Order leaves the battlefield.
• Exile up to two target Insect Mutant or Wurm creatures with mana value 3 or less until Planetary Quarantine Order leaves the battlefield.

033.name: Pollution Quarentine Field
033.effect:
If an opponent would create one or more Pollution tokens, they create that many plus one instead.
As long as an opponent controls four or more Pollution tokens, creatures that player controls can’t attack you or planeswalkers you control.
033.flavor: “Environmental cleanup is now classified as interference with factory output.” — β-013, Factory Overseer

034.name: Pollution Scrubber Sentinel
034.effect:
Whenever a Pollution token would be created, its controller may pay 1. If they do, prevent that token from being created and you gain 1 life.
T: Exile target Pollution token. You gain 1 life.
034.flavor:
“Waste not. If it can’t fuel the factory, at least it can fuel me.” 
— β-013, Factory Overseer

035.name: Priority Loader Mech
035.effect:
Whenever a creature attacks you, you may have that creature’s controller create three tapped Pollution tokens. If you do, create a Overloaded Crate token for each Pollution token they control.
At the beginning of your end step, if you control ten or more creatures named Overloaded Crate, sacrifice Priority Loader Mech.

036.name: Priority Supply Hub
036.effect:
Whenever you create one or more tokens, you may pay 1. If you do, put a supply counter on Priority Supply Hub.
T, Remove a supply counter from Priority Supply Hub: Choose one —
• Create a 1/1 colorless Robot artifact creature token with vigilance.
• Prevent the next 2 damage that would be dealt to you or to a permanent you control this turn.
036.flavor: “If it’s important, it passes through here first.” — β-013, Factory Overseer

037.name: Production-Line Drill
037.effect:
Create a 1/1 colorless Robot artifact creature token with “Start the Production Line.”
If you control an Engineer, scry 1.
037.flavor: “I don’t need brilliance. I need reliability.”— β-013, Factory Overseer

038.name: Scientific Breakthrough
038.effect:
When you cast this spell, if you control an Engineer, scry 2, then draw a card.
Put a +1/+1 counter on each creature you control for each point your Production level is above 0. (For example, if your Production level is 3 , put three +1/+1 counters on each of those creatures.)

039.name: Sector Purge Drone
039.effect:
Vigilance
When Sector Purge Drone enters the battlefield, choose one —
• Destroy all other creatures with power 3 or less. For each creature destroyed this way, its controller creates a Pollution token.
• Exile all Pollution tokens. For each token exiled this way, you gain 1 life.
039.flavor: “If this world insists on resisting order, I’ll clean it one sector at a time.” — β-013, Factory Overseer

040.name: Siege of the First Outpost
040.effect:
(As a Siege enters, choose an opponent to protect it. You and others can attack it.)
When Siege of the First Outpost enters the battlefield, create three 1/1 colorless Robot artifact creature tokens with vigilance.
As long as Siege of the First Outpost has 3 or more defense counters on it, Robots you control get +1/+1.
When Siege of the First Outpost is defeated, you gain 10 life and create two 0/6 colorless Wall artifact creature tokens with defender.

041.name: Systems Cascade Failure
041.effect:
Tap up to two target nonland permanents.
Their controllers can’t activate abilities of those permanents until your next turn.
If a permanent tapped this way is an artifact or an Engineer, scry 1.
041.flavor: “One surge. One glitch. And every protocol I trusted turned into guesswork.” — β-013, Factory Overseer

043.name: Aberrant Recoil
043.effect:
This spell cost 2 less to cast if it targets an Aberrant permanent. (Aberrant is a card that has one or more of the following keywords Insect, Mutant, Nest, Wurm or Horror.)
Return target permanent to its owner’s hand. Surveil 2.
043.flavor: “If it doesn’t fit the model, bounce it out of the system.” — β-013, Factory Overseer

044.name: Arcane Replication Module
044.effect:
Search target opponent’s library for a card, exile it. that opponent shuffles his library.
until the end of your next turn, you may cast that card paying any type of mana for its cast cost. That, card is a colorless artifact while it is on the stack.

045.name: Assembling Machine
045.effect:
Scry 2.
Create a colorless Artifact token named Calibration Node with “Optimize X”
045.flavor: “Reboot the line, leave the node watching the air.” — β-013, Factory Overseer

046.name: Assembling Machine Operator
046.effect:
When Assembling Machine Operator enters the battlefield, scry 1, then draw a card.
Optimize 1 (whenever an opponent create a pollution token you may pay 1, if you do draw one card.)
046.flavor: “If it has a pattern, I can make it faster.” — β-013, Factory Overseer

047.name: Assembly Line Simulation
047.effect:
Tap up to two target nonland permanents. They don’t untap during their controllers untap steps.
If you control a desert or a waste, create a 1/1 colorless Robot artifact creature token with “Start the Production Line.”

048.name: Circuit Archivist Drone
048.effect:
Start the production line! (If players have no Production level, they each start at 0. At each end step, a player with more Optimization than Pollution gets +1 Production, otherwise −1. Production levels range from −3 to 3.)
2, T, Sacrifice Circuit Archivist Drone: Return target instant or sorcery card from your graveyard to your hand.
048.flavor: “Nothing is ever truly lost. Just misfiled in the wrong sector.” — β-013, Factory Overseer

049.name: Circuit Network Bug
049.effect:
Target Research Field loses all abilities until the end of your next turn.
Draw a card.
049.flavor: “Research halted? Figures. Purge the bugs, fix the damage, restart.” — β-013, Factory Overseer

050.name: Circuit Network Calibration
050.effect:
Tap an untapped artifact you control: Mill a card.
If that card is an Optimization card, you may cast it this turn. (Optimization is a card that has one or more of the following keywords Engineer, Start Production Line or Optimize.)
050.flavor: “Every iteration teaches me something. I refuse to waste lessons.” — β-013, Factory Overseer

051.name: Circuit Network Override
051.effect:
Counter target spell unless its controller pays 1 for each Optimization permanent you control.
Draw a card.
051.flavor: “If the logic says ‘stop’, the universe should listen.” — β-013, Factory Overseer

052.name: Circular Logistic
052.effect:
Start The Production Line!
Counter target spell unless its controller pays 1 for each card in your graveyard.
052.flavor: “He didn’t see me…  Not as a person, not as a Planeswalker, not even as a creature.  It was worse: he saw me as a thing, an environmental variable, nonessential.  Just a pattern to be studied.” —  Kiora, the witness

053.name: Codex of Optimization
053.effect:
Optimize X (whenever an opponent create a pollution token you may pay X, if you do draw X cards.)
At the beginning of your upkeep put a knowledge counter on Codex, them surveil X, where X is the number of knowledge counter on Codex.
053.flavor: “Every anomaly is recorded, analyzed, and corrected. Inefficiency will not persist.” — β-013, The Proto-spark owner

054.name: Cognitive Cache Flush
054.effect: Draw three cards. Discard three cards at the beginning of the next end step.
054.flavor:
“Brilliant. Inefficient. Unsustainable. Let’s do it again.”
— β-013, Factory Overseer

055.name: Cognitive Harvest
055.effect:
Target player draws two cards.
Flashback U, Pay 3 life (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
055.flavor: “Extraction processes are finite. When the resources are depleted, I will depart. The world will recover. Your intervention only delays this process.” — β-013, The Proto-spark owner

056.name: Compliance Unit
056.effect:
Whenever Compliance Unit becomes blocked, you may look at defending player’s hand.
T: Target player creates a pollution token unless they pay 1. if they do Compliance Unit attacks in your next combat phase.

057.name: Copper Cable Drone
057.effect:
When Copper Cable Drone enters the battlefield, scry 1.
Whenever you cast an artifact spell or an optimization card, Copper Cable Drone gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
057.flavor:
“If i can keep the signal stable, the rest of the system will follow” 
— β-013, Factory Overseer

058.name: Copper Cable Insight
058.effect:
Scry 1. (Look at the top card of your library. You may put that card on the bottom of your library.)
Draw a card.
058.flavor:
“Single-threaded minds. Multi-threaded wiring. Guess which one bottlenecks first.”
— β-013, Factory Overseer

059.name: Deconstruction Planner
059.effect:
Return up to two nonland permanents to their owners hands.
For each of those permanents an opponent owned, that player creates a Pollution token.
059.flavor: “If I can’t reuse the design, I’ll at least recycle the debris.” — β-013, Factory Overseer

060.name: Don’t Interfere!
060.flavor:
“You have useful abilities. Your control over the element of water could be utilized to optimize transport and refrigeration processes. Efficiency could be upgraded by 18.7%. I offer you partnership.” 
— β-013, The Proto-spark owner

061.name: Efficient Construction
061.effect: Whenever you cast an artifact spell, create a 1/1 colorless Thopter artifact creature token with flying
061.flavor: “Self replication is one of the outcomes of optimization” — β-013, The Proto-spark owner

062.name: Emergency Core Defender
062.effect:
When Emergency Core Defender enters the battlefield, each player may sacrifice a Pollution token.
For each player who does, untap an artifact you control.
For each player who doesn’t, you may pay 1. When you do, put a +1/+1 counter on Emergency Core Defender, then each of those players draws a card.

063.name: Emergency Lab Reboot
063.effect:
Choose one —
• Until end of turn, target Research Lab loses all abilities.
• Untap target Research Lab and scry 1.
063.flavor: “If I can’t stop the sabotage, I can at least hit reboot faster than they can chew wires.” — β-013, Factory Overseer

064.name: Fluid Handling
064.effect:
Whenever an artifact you control becomes tapped, you may untap target nonland permanent.
This ability triggers only once each turn.
064.flavor: “Reroute the flow, relieve the pressure, repeat until stable.” — β-013, Factory Overseer

065.name: Forced Optimization
065.effect:
Cumulative Upkeep: Draw a card.
At the end of your turn discard your hand.
Whenever an optimization card is discarded you may pay 1. If you do, each opponent create a pollution Token.

066.name: Hyperparameter Cascade
066.effect:
For each blue mana spent to cast this spell apply its corresponding tier effect.
0 — Each player returns all nonland permanents they control to their owner’s hand.
1 — Tap all permanents your opponents control. They don’t untap during their controllers’ next untap steps.
2 — Surveil 3, then draw two cards.
3 — Each opponent discards two cards. You draw two cards.
4 — Each opponent create a Pollution token on the battlefield, draw a card for each Pollution token created this way.

067.name: Iron Chest Allocation
067.effect:
Look at the top four cards of your library. You may reveal an artifact or Engineer card from among them and put that card on top of your library. If you do, put the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.
Draw a card.
067.flavor: “proper storage is the difference between a supply line and a junk pile.” — β-013, Factory Overseer

069.name: Optimization Warden
069.effect:
Optimization permanents you control have Hexproof.
If an Optimization permanent you control would leave the battlefield each opponent may pay 1. Each opponent who doesn’t pay creates a pollution token.
069.flavor: “Reshape your world.Optimize it! you don’t need those inefficient ways.” — β-013, The Proto-spark owner

070.name: Proto-spark Prototype
070.effect:
You may look at the top card of you library any time.
you may cast optimization cards from the top of your library as if it was in your hand.
UU: Sacrifice an artifact, return target optimization card from the battlefield or graveyard to your hand.
UUUU, Exile Proto-spark Prototype: Until end of turn, your life total can’t change and you gain protection from everything. All permanents you control phase out.

071.name: Radar Scanner Drone
071.effect:
Whenever one or more creatures attack you, surveil 1 (Look at the top card of your library. You may put it into your graveyard.)
Whenever your production level changes, you may put the top card of your graveyard into you library. If you do shuffle.
071.flavor: “Mapping threats, tracking outputs, predicting failure. I don’t sleep, so nothing escapes my grasp.” — β-013, Factory Overseer

072.name: Research Hijack Drone
072.effect:
Flying
T, Sacrifice Research Hijack Drone: Choose target Research Field. If you don’t control a Research Field, gain control of that permanent. Otherwise, exchange control of that Research Field and a Research Field you control.
072.flavor:
“If knowledge is power, then this world has left its doors unlocked.” 
— β-013, Factory Overseer

073.name: Sandflow Analyzer
073.effect:
6, T: Draw a card. For each Desert target opponent controls untap up to 6 lands.
T: Each opponent create a pollution token.
073.flavor: “Destruction is a byproduct of resource processing. Current extraction efficiency: 94.3%. Losses are calculated and acceptable.” — β-013, The Proto-spark owner

074.name: Sector Recon Arbiter
074.effect: T: Any opponent can chose to create a pollution token, if they don’t Untap two other target permanents.
074.flavor: “You choose: foul the air or free my systems. Either way, the data flows.” — β-013, Factory Overseer

075.name: Steam Power Engine
075.effect:
Affinity for Optimization cards. (This spell costs 1 less to cast for each Optimization card you control.)
T: Decrease your production level by 1.
2U, T: You may sacrifice Steam Power Engine, if you do Draw a card. Otherwise Scry 1.

076.name: Steelswarm Operator
076.effect:
Flying
T: Add U. Spend this mana only to cast an artifact spell.
T: Add UU. Spend this mana only to activate abilities of artifact sources.
076.flavor:
“Pollution is not collateral damage. It is proof of productivity.” 
— β-013, Factory Overseer

077.name: Tech Theft
077.effect:
Enchant Research Lab
You control enchanted Research Lab.
Enchanted Research Lab is a 0/3 colorless artifact creature with defender.
It retains all abilities it had before becoming a creature, except it loses its level up ability.

078.name: Uncanny Feeling
078.effect:
Whenever you would be target of an activated ability or spell, you may mil X cards. If you do, chose a new target for that ability or spell and put five destiny counters on Uncanny Feeling.
X are equal to the number o destiny counters on Uncanny Feeling.

079.name: War Observation Drone
079.effect:
Flash, Flying
Whenever an artifact creature you control deals combat damage to a player, draw a card.
079.flavor: “How can someone look at this… at the anguish of an entire world and see only data?” — Chandra Nalaar

080.name: You Can Always Rebuild
080.effect:
Start the production line! (If players have no Production level, they each start at 0. At each end step, a player with more Optimization than Pollution gets +1 Production, otherwise −1. Production levels range from −3 to 3.)
Each player discard their hands, then they may shuffles their graveyard into their library.
Each player draw two cards.

226.name: The Demolisher
226.effect:
Trample, Deathtouch
The Demolisher gets +x/+x, where x is equal to the number of Deserts and wastes on the battlefield.
If The Demolisher would leave the battlefield, sacrifice it instead. 
When The Demolisher dies, exile all nonland permanents controlled by each player who controls a Pollution token.
226.flavor: “First I’ll rebuild the factory. Then this aberration pays for every delay.” — β-013, Factory Overseer

227.name: β-013, Factory Overseer
227.effect:
Vigilance
Start the production line! 
At the beginning of your upkeep, each opponent that controls a Pollution token creates a Bitter token.
Insect Mutant creatures your opponents control are goaded.
227.flavor: “This world is a cost I’m willing to pay. The factory must grow.”  — β-013, Factory Overseer

249.name: Graveglass Wastes
249.effect:
(As long as this land isn’t on the battlefield, it’s a basic Swamp in addition to its other types.)
T: Add B.

251.name: Mirage Dunefield
251.effect:
(As long as this land isn’t on the battlefield, it’s a basic Island in addition to its other types.)
T: Add U.

253.name: Overgrown Sandwilds
253.effect:
(As long as this land isn’t on the battlefield, it’s a basic Forest in addition to its other types.)
T: Add G.

255.name: Scorched Ember Dunes
255.effect:
(As long as this land isn’t on the battlefield, it’s a basic Mountain in addition to its other types.)
T: Add R.

256.name: Sunbleached Expanse
256.effect:
(As long as this land isn’t on the battlefield, it’s a basic Plains in addition to its other types.)
T: Add W.

258.name: Voidglass Desert
258.effect:
(As long as this land isn’t on the battlefield, it’s a basic Waste in addition to its other types.)
T: Add C.

260.name: Ashen Bloodbarrens
260.effect:
Optimize 1 (whenever an opponent create a pollution token you may pay 1, if you do draw one card.)
This land enters tapped.
T: Add B or R. This land deals 1 damage to you.

261.name: Aurora Warcrest Dunes
261.effect:
T: Add R, W or U. This land deals 1 damage to you.
Pollute 3 (3, discard this card: Each opponent create a Pollution Token.)

262.name: Bleached Bone Flats
262.effect:
Optimize 1 (whenever an opponent create a pollution token you may pay 1, if you do draw one card.)
This land enters tapped.
T: Add W or B. This land deals 1 damage to you.

263.name: Carrion Ember Barrens
263.effect:
T: Add B, R or G. This land deals 1 damage to you.
Pollute 3 (3, discard this card: Each opponent create a Pollution Token.)

264.name: Crimson Dune Tribunal
264.effect:
T: Add W, B or R. This land deals 1 damage to you.
Pollute 3 (3, discard this card: Each opponent create a Pollution Token.)

265.name: Drowned Dune Necropolis
265.effect:
Optimize 1 (whenever an opponent create a pollution token you may pay 1, if you do draw one card.)
This land enters tapped.
T: Add U or B. This land deals 1 damage to you.

266.name: Fungal Silt Expanse
266.effect:
T: Add G, U or B. This land deals 1 damage to you.
Pollute 3 (3, discard this card: Each opponent create a Pollution Token.)

267.name: Glassfire Expanse
267.effect:
Glassfire Expanse enters the battlefield tapped.
T: Add W, U, B or R. This land deals 1 damage to you.

268.name: Oasis of Shifting Canopies
268.effect:
T: Add G, W or U. This land deals 1 damage to you.
Pollute 3

269.name: Obsidian Mirage Plateau
269.effect:
T: Add W, U or B. This land deals 1 damage to you.
Pollute 3 (3, discard this card: Each opponent create a Pollution Token.)

270.name: Primeval Ashwaste Wilds
270.effect:
Primeval Ashwaste wilds enters the battlefield tapped.
T: Add U, B, R or G. This land deals 1 damage to you.

271.name: Radiant Gale Dunecrest
271.effect:
Radiant Gale Dunecrest enters the battlefield tapped.
T: Add R, G, W or U. This land deals 1 damage to you.

272.name: Rotten Dune Hollow
272.effect:
Optimize 1 (whenever an opponent create a pollution token you may pay 1, if you do draw one card.)
This land enters tapped.
T: Add U or R. This land deals 1 damage to you.

273.name: Sacred Rot Saltmarsh
273.effect:
T: Add B, G or W. This land deals 1 damage to you.
Pollute 3 (3, discard this card: Each opponent create a Pollution Token.)

274.name: Shimmering Salt Flats
274.effect:
Optimize 1 (whenever an opponent create a pollution token you may pay 1, if you do draw one card.)
This land enters tapped.
T: Add W or U. This land deals 1 damage to you.

275.name: Silent Grave-Oasis
275.effect:
Silent Grave-Oasis enters the battlefield tapped.
T: Add G, W, U or B. This land deals 1 damage to you.

276.name: Stormcinder Glasslands
276.effect:
T: Add U, B or R. This land deals 1 damage to you.
Pollute 3 (3, discard this card: Each opponent create a Pollution Token.)

277.name: Sunbrand Frontier Reach
277.effect:
T: Add R, G or W. This land deals 1 damage to you.
Pollute 3 (3, discard this card: Each opponent create a Pollution Token.)

285.name: Himura’s Favorite Card
285.effect:
This spell costs U less to cast for each player in the game.
Each player exiles their hand, all permanents they control, and all cards from their graveyard into separate piles.
For each card exiled from their graveyard this way, that player mills a card.
For each permanent exiled from their battlefield this way, that player reveals cards from the top of their library until they reveal a permanent card. If it’s a land card, they put it onto the battlefield. If it’s another permanent card, they cast it without paying its mana cost. If they can’t cast that card, they put it onto the battlefield. Otherwise, they put the revealed card on the bottom of their library.
For each card exiled from their hand, that player draws a card.
At the beginning of your end step, each player shuffles all cards they exiled this way into their library.

For each permanent exiled from their battlefield this way, that player reveals cards from the top of their library until they reveal a permanent card. If it’s a land card, they put it onto the battlefield. If it’s another permanent card, they cast it without paying its mana cost. If they can’t cast that card, they put it onto the battlefield. Otherwise, they put the revealed card on the bottom of their library.
For each card exiled from their hand, that player draws a card.
At the beginning of your end step, each player shuffles all cards they exiled this way into their library.
